Package org.apache.zookeeper.server.auth

Class X509AuthenticationConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.zookeeper.server.auth.X509AuthenticationConfig
  • public class X509AuthenticationConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains config properties for x509-based authentication

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String ALLOWED_CLIENT_ID_AS_ACL_DOMAINS
      A list of domain names that can set node ACLs as their own client ID.
      static java.lang.String CROSS_DOMAIN_ACCESS_DOMAIN_NAME
      A list of domain names that will have cross-domain access privilege, separated by ","
      static java.lang.String DEDICATED_DOMAIN
      If the server is dedicated for one domain, use this config property to define the domain name, and enable connection filtering feature for this domain.
      static java.lang.String ENFORCE_DEDICATED_DOMAIN
      This config property applies only to dedicated server.
      static java.lang.String OPEN_READ_ACCESS_PATH_PREFIX
      A list of znode path prefixes, separated by ",".
      static java.lang.String SET_X509_CLIENT_ID_AS_ACL
      Enables/disables whether znodes created by auth'ed clients.
      static java.lang.String SSL_X509_CLIENT_CERT_ID_SAN_EXTRACT_MATCHER_GROUP_INDEX
      Specifies match group index for the extract regex (i in Matcher.group(i)), default value 0
      static java.lang.String SSL_X509_CLIENT_CERT_ID_SAN_EXTRACT_REGEX
      Extract Regex is used to construct a client ID (acl entity) to return, default value ".*"
      static java.lang.String SSL_X509_CLIENT_CERT_ID_SAN_MATCH_REGEX
      Match Regex is used to choose which entry to use, default value ".*"
      static java.lang.String SSL_X509_CLIENT_CERT_ID_SAN_MATCH_TYPE
      The field in SAN to be used for client URI extraction
      static java.lang.String SSL_X509_CLIENT_CERT_ID_TYPE
      Determines which field in the x509 certificate to be used for client Id: SAN (subject alternative name) or SDN (subject domain name) (default)
      static java.lang.String SSL_X509_CONFIG_PREFIX
      Config prefix for x509-related config properties.
      static java.lang.String STORE_AUTHED_CLIENT_ID
      This config property applies to non-dedicated server.
      static java.lang.String SUBJECT_ALTERNATIVE_NAME_SHORT  
      static java.lang.String ZNODE_GROUP_ACL_CONFIG_PREFIX
      Config prefix for znode group acl-related config properties
      static java.lang.String ZOOKEEPER_ZNODEGROUPACL_SUPERUSER_ID
      A user-defined URI represents a super user, same concept as the original x509 superuser.

      • SSL_X509_CONFIG_PREFIX

        public static final java.lang.String SSL_X509_CONFIG_PREFIX
        Config prefix for x509-related config properties. The property keys start with this prefix apply to both X509AuthenticationProvider and X509ZNodeGroupAclProvider
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final java.lang.String SSL_X509_CLIENT_CERT_ID_TYPE

        See Also:

        Constant Field Values

      • SET_X509_CLIENT_ID_AS_ACL

        public static final java.lang.String SET_X509_CLIENT_ID_AS_ACL
        Enables/disables whether znodes created by auth'ed clients. Should be enabled if znode group acl feature is desired; otherwise, it should be disabled. When this property is enabled: 1. Should have ACL fields populated with the client Id given by the authentication provider. 2. Users do not have the right to manually operate on znode ACLs 3. "zookeeper.X509ZNodeGroupAclProvider.superUserId" has the ability to operate on znode ACLs Has the same effect as the ZK client using ZooDefs.Ids.CREATOR_ALL_ACL.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CROSS_DOMAIN_ACCESS_DOMAIN_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String CROSS_DOMAIN_ACCESS_DOMAIN_NAME
        A list of domain names that will have cross-domain access privilege, separated by ","
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ZOOKEEPER_ZNODEGROUPACL_SUPERUSER_ID

        public static final java.lang.String ZOOKEEPER_ZNODEGROUPACL_SUPERUSER_ID
        A user-defined URI represents a super user, same concept as the original x509 superuser. Super user can operate on the znode to set ACLs.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • OPEN_READ_ACCESS_PATH_PREFIX

        public static final java.lang.String OPEN_READ_ACCESS_PATH_PREFIX
        A list of znode path prefixes, separated by ",". Znode whose path starts with the defined path prefix would have open read access. Meaning the znode will have (world:anyone, r) ACL.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEDICATED_DOMAIN

        public static final java.lang.String DEDICATED_DOMAIN
        If the server is dedicated for one domain, use this config property to define the domain name, and enable connection filtering feature for this domain.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ENFORCE_DEDICATED_DOMAIN

        public static final java.lang.String ENFORCE_DEDICATED_DOMAIN
        This config property applies only to dedicated server. When true (default), domain specific connection filtering is enabled and enforced. When false, the server simply logs a warning message but doesn't actually filter/disconnect the connection if it does not belong to dedicated domain.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STORE_AUTHED_CLIENT_ID

        public static final java.lang.String STORE_AUTHED_CLIENT_ID
        This config property applies to non-dedicated server. If this property is set to true, clientId extracted from the certificate will be stored in authInfo, along with the matched domain name.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ALLOWED_CLIENT_ID_AS_ACL_DOMAINS

        public static final java.lang.String ALLOWED_CLIENT_ID_AS_ACL_DOMAINS
        A list of domain names that can set node ACLs as their own client ID.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public boolean isZnodeGroupAclDedicatedServerEnabled()
        Check if server dedicated domain config property is set This check is only meaningful when x509 znode group acl feature is enabled
        Returns:
        true if a domain is set as the server's dedicated domain; false if not set

      • isX509ZnodeGroupAclEnabled

        public boolean isX509ZnodeGroupAclEnabled()
        Check if x509 znode group acl feature is enabled
        Returns:
        true if enabled; false if not
